title: 'Leave Iran': India issues fresh warning to its nationals as tensions soar in Middle East
content: Amidst escalating Middle East tensions and fears of war, the Indian Embassy in Tehran has urgently advised all Indian nationals, including students and tourists, to depart Iran. This directive follows previous advisories and comes as US President Donald Trump issued a stern warning to Tehran regarding nuclear deal negotiations.  The embassy has provided contact details for assistance.

title: 'Minor incident': HAL dismisses Tejas 'crash' reports; defends jets' safety record
content: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) has clarified that a recent incident reports claiming that a Tejas jet crashed was actually a minor technical issue on the ground. The company emphasized the aircraft's strong safety record and is working with the Indian Air Force for resolution. This statement follows reports of significant damage to a Tejas after overshooting a runway.

title: 'Will defend ferociously': Iran rejects Trump's 'limited strike' warning
content: Iran has warned that any US attack, even a limited one, would be considered an act of aggression and met with a decisive response. This comes as President Trump considers military action to force a nuclear deal, despite ongoing indirect talks and a significant US military build-up in the region.

title: 'We were humiliated on all fronts': Ex-India captain fumes after Super 8 disaster
content: Former captain Kris Srikkanth launched a fierce critique of India's batting collapse against South Africa in the T20 World Cup. He lambasted the reckless approach, questionable batting order, and poor decision-making, particularly highlighting Ishan Kishan's dismissal and Suryakumar Yadav's batting position. Srikkanth warned of lingering negative mindsets after the humiliating defeat.

title: 'Mohabbat ki dukaan ka yoddha': Rahul meets ‘Mohammad Deepak’, man who confronted Bajrang Dal
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi met Deepak Kumar, a gym owner from Kotdwar, Uttarakhand, who intervened when Bajrang Dal members allegedly harassed a Muslim shopkeeper over his store's name.  Gandhi praised Kumar's courage and commitment to unity, highlighting his stand against injustice. The incident involved protests and police intervention, with tensions rising after threats against Kumar.

title: Musk's 'they don't have money' for OpenAI may be coming true & affecting two of its biggest partners
content: A massive $500 billion AI data center project, Stargate, announced with fanfare at the White House, has stalled. Internal disagreements between partners OpenAI and SoftBank, coupled with funding challenges, have halted construction and leadership development. This setback has significantly impacted Oracle's stock and OpenAI's compute capacity targets, highlighting the difficulties of large-scale infrastructure development.

title: Silent signs of high blood pressure you shouldn’t ignore, according to cardiologists
content: High blood pressure is a stealthy adversary, frequently presenting with gentle clues that can escalate into serious health crises. Medical professionals point out that symptoms like nagging headaches upon waking, unexpected fatigue, trouble catching your breath, lightheadedness, and fuzzy vision could be warning signs.

title: Student wing forms human chain as Muslim students pray outside sealed Lucknow University mosque
content: Students protested outside Lucknow University's Lal Baradari after the mosque was sealed, preventing Muslim students from praying during Ramzan. Hindu student leaders formed a human chain, showcasing communal harmony. The university cited the building's dilapidated state and safety concerns, while students alleged a lack of sensitivity and discrimination.

title: 'Non-earning doesn't mean idle': HC affirms value of homemaker's work; grants maintenance
content: The Delhi High Court affirmed the economic value of homemakers' contributions, stating their work is crucial for a spouse's effectiveness. Justice Swarana Kanta Sharma emphasized that unemployment doesn't equate to idleness, and the law must recognize unpaid domestic labor. The court awarded Rs 50,000 in maintenance, rejecting the notion that a wife's ability to earn negates her right to support.

title: Anthropic’s lead engineer has a Doomsday prediction for engineers, product managers and designers
content: Anthropic engineer Borsi Cherny warns that advanced AI agents, like Claude Code, will soon transform nearly all computer-based jobs, potentially eliminating roles like software engineer by 2026.  He urges workers to adapt and embrace these tools, as similar concerns about AI's impact on entry-level positions are echoed by Federal Reserve Governor Michael Barr and Oxford Economics.

title: Shadab Khan's 'Pakistan will play the final' claim goes viral - watch
content: Pakistan allrounder Shadab Khan expressed confidence in his team reaching the T20 World Cup 2026 final. This statement comes as Pakistan prepares for a crucial Super Eights match against England. The pitch is expected to favor spinners. England has started their Super Eights campaign strongly. Pakistan needs a strong batting performance to succeed.

title: 'They were drunk, started abusing us': IAF jawan, his father assaulted in UP
content: An Indian Air Force jawan and his father were allegedly attacked with rods and sticks by members of a wedding procession near Amargarh village, Bulandshahr, on February 19th. The duo claims the procession, led by Akash Sharma, blocked the road and became abusive after they honked. Both sustained serious injuries, with the father briefly losing consciousness.

title: 'Axar Patel has been your MVP': Ashwin slams Gambhir for dropping vice-captain
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has voiced his disagreement with the team management's decision to bench Axar Patel for the crucial T20 World Cup Super 8 match against South Africa. Ashwin argued that while match-up strategies are common in franchise cricket, international tournaments demand team stability, highlighting Axar's proven T20 prowess and past crucial performances.

title: When Steve Jobs told Apple employees during a townhall: Nike sells shoes, and yet ...
content: Steve Jobs, upon his return to Apple in 1997, found inspiration in Nike's marketing to revitalize the brand. He emphasized that marketing should focus on values and what a company stands for, not just product specifications. Jobs believed Apple, like Nike, should connect with people's passions and their desire to change the world.

title: Red Fort, Delhi secretariat receive bomb threats emails; security on high alert
content: Bomb threat emails were received at the Army Public School in Dhaula Kuan and Air Force Bal Bharti School in Lodhi Road in Delhi, triggering immediate search operations by authorities, though nothing suspicious has been found yet.

title: How Dwarka Expressway became a real estate goldmine and why so many people are investing here
content: Dwarka Expressway is rapidly transforming into a prime real estate hub in Delhi-NCR, attracting homebuyers and investors with its enhanced connectivity to Delhi, Gurugram, and the airport. The corridor's modern planning, coupled with luxury developments and future infrastructure, is driving significant property value appreciation and offering lucrative investment opportunities.

title: Why did Bombay HC impose Rs 11 costs on two BMC officers? Court explains delay in acting
content: The Bombay High Court directed two senior Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai (BMC) officers to pay Rs 11 each from their salaries for delaying action against a ward officer. This token cost aims to emphasize prompt compliance with court orders, highlighting institutional delays despite the Municipal Commissioner's swift action.

title: Rajpal Yadav resumes work after Jail release, starts shooting for 'Welcome to the Jungle' - Reports
content: Rajpal Yadav has begun shooting for Welcome to the Jungle soon after his release from Tihar Jail on bail in a cheque bounce case. The Delhi High Court granted him interim relief until March 18. Expressing gratitude to fans, he will also attend a press conference in Mumbai on February 28.

title: Man stabbed for ‘speaking Bengali’ in Madhya Pradesh
content: A Malda man, working as a cloth vendor in Madhya Pradesh for nine years, was stabbed and robbed in Sagar. His family alleges he was targeted for speaking Bengali, a fear he had recently expressed. Authorities are arranging his treatment and rehabilitation.

title: Why are gold prices rising? Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman explains
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman attributed rising gold prices to increased buying by central banks and strong domestic demand. She assured that the government is monitoring the situation, noting it hasn't reached alarming levels. Sitharaman also stated the finance ministry is assessing the impact of a US Supreme Court ruling on tariffs.

title: ‘Time to pull our sleeves up’: Coach Doeschate hints at India XI shake-up
content: Following a heavy defeat to South Africa in Super 8s, India's batting unit faces scrutiny, with assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirming that changes, including the potential inclusion of Sanju Samson, are being considered. The team's left-hand heavy top order has struggled, prompting a rethink of their strategy for upcoming crucial matches.

title: Bengaluru horror: 19-year-old psychology student drugged, gang-raped by 2 inside villa
content: A 19-year-old psychology student from Tamil Nadu has accused two men, including a friend, of gang-raping her after she was allegedly drugged at a party in north Bengaluru. The incident reportedly occurred around midnight on Saturday at a villa in Jakkur. The student stated she was disoriented and unable to resist the assault.

title: Mexico tense after El Mencho’s death: Videos show chaos as cartel members storm airport
content: Mexico's most wanted cartel leader, Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho," was killed by the government, sparking widespread violent reprisals. Cartel operatives retaliated by blocking roads, torching businesses, and vehicles across several states, demonstrating their power and reach. The unrest disrupted daily life, including transportation and events, highlighting the significant influence of organized crime.

title: ‘Be humble & improve fast’: Ex-batter's warning after India’s T20 WC reality check
content: Following a heavy defeat to South Africa in the Super 8 stage, former batter Sanjay Manjrekar urged India to be humble and address key flaws. He highlighted struggles against spin and pace-off deliveries, suggesting a batting order reshuffle and strengthening the bowling attack with Kuldeep Yadav to improve their title chances.

title: UAE announces 4-day Eid Al Fitr holiday for public sector; Will private sector get an extra day?
content: UAE has announced the Eid Al Fitr holiday schedule, offering early clarity for all. Federal government employees get a break from March 19-22, 2026. Private sector workers will enjoy a holiday from March 19-21, with a potential extension to March 22 depending on Ramadan's duration. This allows ample time for planning.

title: 'Sexually assaulted boys at his gurukul': Swami Avimukteshwaranand booked under Pocso Act
content: A prominent religious figure, Swami Avimukteshwaranand, and his associate face serious charges under the Pocso Act. They are accused of sexually exploiting two minor boys at their Prayagraj camp over the past year. The complaint, filed by another religious leader, alleges the abuse occurred during religious events. Police have registered an FIR following a court order.

title: Ex-BJP MP took back blanket after learning woman was Muslim; video sparks row
content: Rajasthan's Leader of Opposition, Tikaram Jully, accused former BJP MP Sukhbir Singh Jaunapuria of religious discrimination.  A video allegedly shows Jaunapuria withdrawing a blanket from a Muslim woman in Tonk district after inquiring about her religion.  He reportedly stated those abusing the Prime Minister shouldn't receive aid, sparking condemnation for alleged bias.

title: Holika Dahan Puja Muhurat: Rituals must be done on March 2; lunar eclipse falls on Holi
content: A rare celestial event, Chandra Grahan, will occur on March 3, 2026, coinciding with Holi. Due to the lunar eclipse and its Sutak period, Holika Dahan puja will be conducted on March 2, 2026. This adjustment ensures the auspicious timing for the traditional ceremony. Dhulendi will be celebrated on March 4, 2026.

title: What is the IDFC First Bank Rs 590 cr fraud case? Explained in 10 points
content: IDFC First Bank Managing Director and CEO V. Vaidyanathan sought to limit the fallout, asserting that the lapse was restricted in scope and stemmed from internal collusion rather than any broader structural weakness.

title: ‘Chanakya of Bengal politics’ passes away at 71: Former TMC leader Mukul Roy dies of cardiac arrest
content: Veteran politician Mukul Roy, a former railway minister and founding TMC member, passed away from a cardiac arrest at 1:30 am. Roy, who represented Krishnanagar Uttar and served twice in the Rajya Sabha, had a notable political journey, including stints with the BJP before rejoining the TMC. His son confirmed the news.

title: 'He is son of a big politician': How argument over 'dust' snowballed into racial abuse in Delhi
content: Three women from Arunachal Pradesh faced racial slurs and threats in Delhi's Malviya Nagar after a dispute over falling debris. Neighbors allegedly hurled derogatory remarks about their community and profession. Police have registered a case following a viral video of the incident, which began during AC installation work.

title: ‘24 months of planning, Raza’s spark’: Ryan Burl on Zimbabwe’s dream run
content: Zimbabwe have defied expectations, reaching the Super 8s of the 2026 T20 World Cup through a meticulously executed 24-month plan.  Their journey, marked by wins against Oman, Australia, and Sri Lanka, showcases strategic hard work and belief. Now, facing giants like India, South Africa and the West Indies, the team remains focused on their next challenge, one game at a time.

title: 'Threw me out of house': 9-month pregnant woman assaulted by husband, in-laws in Bengaluru
content: A pregnant woman in Bengaluru has accused her husband and in-laws of assault and prolonged cruelty, detailing a pattern of verbal and physical abuse that escalated during her pregnancies. The complaint, filed at the South Women Police Station, alleges infidelity accusations and forced displacement from their home, despite her advanced stage of pregnancy.

title: 24-year-old rams car into family over parking dispute in TN; 1 killed, 3 injured
content: A dispute over parked vehicles escalated tragically in Hosur when a youth allegedly rammed his car into an assistant labour inspector and his family. The inspector, K Sivamoorthy, died on the way to the hospital. His son and daughter-in-law were also injured. The 24-year-old driver and his two friends have been arrested and remanded in judicial custody.

title: ‘Easy targets’: How Pune techie robbed her own grandmother and 2 uncles; stole 15 tolas gold
content: A 31-year-old software engineer in Pune has been detained for allegedly spraying a solution on her grandmother during a robbery attempt. Investigations reveal she also targeted two other elderly relatives in separate thefts, stealing gold and valuables. Police suspect financial losses from share trading motivated her actions, as she viewed elderly relatives as easy targets.

title: 'We've got to take him down': Miller reveals strategy that dismantled Chakravarthy
content: David Miller revealed South Africa's strategic clarity and disciplined execution were key to their dominant Super 8 victory over India. He emphasized capitalizing on loose deliveries and taking calculated risks against spinner Varun Chakravarthy, who had a difficult outing. Miller's composed, fundamental approach underpinned his match-winning 63 off 35 balls.

title: Across Manipur’s fault line, Kuki man visits Meitei mother-in-law
content: Despite three years of conflict dividing communities, Anthony Naulak, a Paite man, visited his Meitei mother-in-law in Imphal, symbolizing a personal bridge across ethnic divides. He also arrived to advocate for internally displaced persons, urging the new government to translate promises into action for those suffering in relief camps.

title: Trump’s tariff defeat: India and China big winners; US allies pay the price
content: India emerges a key beneficiary as the US Supreme Court struck down President Trump's emergency tariffs. This ruling injects leverage into ongoing trade talks, potentially allowing New Delhi to secure better terms. While offering temporary relief, the shift to a new tariff framework signals a complex period for global exporters and US trade policy. UK has been the biggest loser among the US allies.

title: ‘Mothers, sisters living in fear’: PM Modi writes to people of Bengal ahead of polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed heartbreak over West Bengal's current condition in a letter to voters, accusing the state government of "extreme non-cooperation." He highlighted central government schemes that have benefited millions in the state and pledged to build a developed and prosperous West Bengal if the BJP comes to power.

title: Stabbed 24 times in 30 seconds: 2 minors storm snooker club, hack Class 10 boy
content: Two 16-year-old boys allegedly attacked another 16-year-old with a large knife at a pool club in Teela Jamalpura, inflicting over two dozen blows. The incident, reportedly stemming from an old dispute where the victim had previously assaulted the accused, occurred on February 15. Police have registered a case against the minor assailants.

title: 'They are great actors and very clever': The Birdman of Jharkhand who can talk to the birds
content: Panna Lal Mahto, known as the "Birdman" of Jharkhand, dedicates his life to helping sparrows and other birds. He builds nests, conducts awareness programs, and uses his remarkable talent for mimicking bird calls to educate others about conservation. Driven by passion and his own pocket, he has significantly increased bird habitation in his region.

title: India qualification scenario: How can Team India reach T20 WC semi-final?
content: India's T20 World Cup 2026 semi-final hopes are in jeopardy following a significant 76-run defeat to South Africa. Chasing 188, India crumbled to 111, with Marco Jansen taking four wickets. This loss severely impacted India's Net Run Rate, leaving them needing crucial wins against the West Indies and Zimbabwe to advance.

title: Dragged, assaulted, dumped on road: Kolkata woman molested by friend inside moving car
content: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly molested and assaulted by her 18-year-old friend, Arnab Shaw, who then forced her out of a moving car on Diamond Harbour Road. Police intercepted and arrested Shaw after a chase. The woman reported being wrongfully confined, physically assaulted, and threatened before being ejected from the vehicle.

title: 'Simply throwing the bat': Gavaskar tears into India after Super 8 collapse
content: India suffered a devastating 76-run loss to South Africa in their T20 World Cup Super 8 opener. The batting lineup crumbled chasing 187, with only Shivam Dube offering resistance. Experts criticized India's approach, contrasting it with South Africa's adaptable batting. This heavy defeat severely impacts India's net run rate and semi-final hopes.

title: Tamil Nadu election: We are prepared to face ED, I-T, and CBI, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: The BJP government has been preventing the registration of FIRs related to corruption charges against some former Ministers through the Governor, alleges CM Stalin

title: Too early to comment on U.S. tariff changes; Commerce Ministry reviewing situation: Sitharaman
content: The Finance Minister said India has been on a very clear path of wanting to have trade deals and has already inked pacts with Australia, New Zealand, the UAE, Qatar, Oman, the EU and the U.K.

title: Elimination of JeM’s Saifullah terror group displays high standards of tactical precision: Major General A.P.S. Bal
content: The Army said the security forces persisted in this long-duration and large-scale operation, which spanned over a month

title: Not interested in watching ‘The Kerala Story 2’, says State BJP chief Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: Citing freedom of speech and expression guaranteed by Constitution, the BJP leader says it is ‘up to the courts’ to decide if there is anything ‘illegal’ in a film

title: SIR: T.N. electorate stands at 5.67 crore as Election Commission publishes final electoral roll
content: In the draft electoral roll, more than 97.3 lakh electors – or 15% of those on the roll – were removed

title: Tamil Nadu SIR: Chennai records 28.3 lakh voters in final electoral roll
content: Perambur constituency has the highest number of voters at 2,22,792, while Harbour has the lowest at 1,16,896

title: Six passengers, conductor injured as TGSRTC bus falls off a bridge into dry bed of stream
content: The accident occurred when the driver of the Asifabad-bound TGSRTC bus lost control of the vehicle while negotiating a narrow bridge, without a protection wall, near Shyampur

title: CJI says 'general' directions in 2018 hate crime judgment may be 'unmanageable', favours case-to-case action
content: The eight-year-old verdict had reverberated as a sharp judicial criticism against a spate of lynchings and communally-coloured mob violence which had occurred since 2014

title: Tamil Nadu SIR 2026: How to check your name in final voter list
content: The final voter roll was initially scheduled for release on February 17 but was later postponed to February 23.

title: First scientific assessment establishes Kaziranga as a fishing cat stronghold
content: The study was based on camera-trap images available from all-India tiger estimation data to determine if the feline species is rare or common in the national park

title: India releases first anti-terror policy PRAHAAR
content: MHA policy emphasises that, in addition to terrorism sponsored from across the border, “criminal hackers and nation-states are targeting India with cyber-attacks”

title: Hyderabad airport contributes nearly ₹68,000 crore to Telangana economy, supports 3.5 lakh jobs
content: A NCAER study notes that the airport’s rise has coincided with the State’s transformation into one of India’s most competitive economies

title: Unemployed wife not idle, unjust to disregard her labour: Delhi HC
content: The court also raised concern over maintenance proceedings often becoming "intensely adversarial", saying it rarely served the long-term interests of either parties, or their minor children

title: Tirupati laddu row: Administrative enquiry does not overlap criminal case, observes SC
content: Bench said the one-man committee administrative enquiry initiated by the Andhra Pradesh government would not come in the way of criminal proceedings in which multiple chargesheets have already been filed in court

title: Former Andhra CM Jagan Mohan Reddy to visit Pulivendula for two-day tour from February 24
content: Party sources said the visit is aimed at strengthening grassroots connections and reviewing local concerns in the constituency

title: Indian Embassy in Tehran advises its citizens to leave Iran
content: Fresh anti-Government protests have erupted in Iran as students held protests which led to clashes at several ​Iranian universities

title: Anuria deaths due to suspected milk contamination rises to four in Rajahmundry
content: All the deaths and new patients had a history of consuming milk supplied by the same vendor; Eight more patients are being treated for anuria; Blood samples of 73 families are being tested.

title: College student alleges gang rape at villa in north Bengaluru; two booked
content: On February 14, the accused allegedly invited the complainant to a party at a place named Rex Villa, near Jakkur

title: Alleged custodial torture of former MP: CID DIG Sunil Kumar Naik arrested
content: The Bihar cadre IGP was Accused No. 7 in the alleged custodial torture of Raghu Rama Krishna Raju, who is the Deputy Speaker of AP Legislative Assembly now

title: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju says NDA will fight elections to form govt in Kerala
content: The State has always lacked a right government which can take it to the next level of prosperity, Rijiju said

title: What is Kerala’s Nativity Card Bill: Explained
content: Kerala Assembly has referred to Subject Committee the Kerala Nativity Card Bill that seeks to give legal backing to the nativity card initiative for issuing an authoritative identity proof to Keralites

title: Sabarimala gold case: M.B. Rajesh’s Kerala Assembly remark reveals bid to implicate Tantri, says K.C. Venugopal
content: “We believe it reflects hostility toward the Tantri. Otherwise, why would the minister criticise a court verdict” Mr. Venugopal said

title: India–Cuba IT council launched in Bengaluru to boost tech cooperation
content: The agreement establishes a structured framework for cooperation in information technology, digital transformation, innovation ecosystems, technology education, and cross-border IT business promotion between the two countries.

title: Supreme Court to finally hear Kerala Devaswom Recruitment Board appeal on power of appointment in Guruvayoor Devaswom on March 10
content: The KDRB has sought a stay of the High Court decision while submitting that its functions were limited to affairs of recruitment and did not intervene in the religious duties concerning temples

title: Bombay HC quashes order staying proceedings against Anil Ambani to classify his bank accounts as fraud
content: Three banks in their appeal said the forensic audit, which led to accounts being classified as "fraud", was legally valid and based on serious findings of fund siphoning and misutilisation

title: Bulldozer demolition drive: Supreme Court asks district election officer to address issue of people lacking ‘identifiable abode’
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant was hearing a petition filed by Sana Parveen on the plight of residents of Akbar Nagar in Lucknow

title: Villagers stage 'jal satyagraha' flagging water crisis in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra
content: Protesters claimed that roads were dug and pipelines were laid two-three years ago after surveys, but household taps are yet to be installed, forcing villagers to consume contaminated river water

title: Lakshmipriya’s BAFTA win a moment of immense pride for entire nation: Manipur CM
content: CM Khemchand Singh said Lakshmipriya Devi has consistently brought laurels through her outstanding work in cinema, and this latest honour further elevates the stature of Manipuri art and culture on the global stage

title: Kerala signs ₹2,000-crore logistics pacts with central PSUs for Vizhinjam port
content: Initiative marks a strategic shift to transform port into a comprehensive economic development hub, ensuring that critical infrastructure remains under public sector oversight even as the port operates on a Public-Private Partnership model

title: Watch any film you want at Bengaluru’s Suchitra Film Society now
content: The film society has a collection of about 6,000 films in its digital archives, including foreign, Indian and independent cinema, which film lovers can now access

title: Sabarimala gold theft case: SIT likely to challenge bail granted to Tantri Kandararu Rajeevaru
content: Officials say SIT earlier sought legal opinion on overriding certain damning observations made by Kollam Vigilance court while granting bail to Tantri

title: Mumbai-Pune Expressway traffic: MSRDC to credit toll refunds to FASTags after 33-hour ordeal
content: The refund, amounting to approximately ₹5.16 crore, will be credited directly to the FASTags of the affected vehicle owners, a senior MSRDC official confirmed

title: Thane tribunal orders ₹28.68 lakh compensation to tailor, domestic help injured in 2018 accident
content: The tailor suffered 80% permanent disability after paralysis of both her lower limbs, but the MACT pegged her functional disability at 50%, noting that contemporary electric sewing machines may be operated using hands and elbows.

title: Two brothers shot dead at wedding reception in Patna
content: Tragedy struck a wedding reception in Shahpur village, Bihar, late Sunday evening. Two brothers, Manjeet Kumar and Manish Kumar, were shot dead by unidentified assailants. Preliminary investigations suggest an old dispute, possibly property-related, led to the fatal incident. Police are actively searching for the accused and have sent the bodies for post-mortem.

title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee condoles Mukul Roy's death, recalls long political association
content: The West Bengal CM said she was "shocked and saddened" by Mr. Roy's passing and recalled that he had worked tirelessly for the Trinamool Congress since its founding, earning acceptance across all levels of the party

title: Kerala’s LDF govt to announce completion of 5 lakh houses under LIFE Mission on February 24
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan says government has spent around ₹20,831.60 crore on LIFE Mission scheme

title: Tamil Nadu Assembly election: MMK to contest on DMK’s ‘Rising Sun’ symbol
content: The party led by M.H. Jawahirullah held talks with the DMK’s seat-sharing committee on Monday and sought five seats

title: Maharashtra Health Minister promises strict action in Thane egg-donation racket
content: Police recently busted the racket, wherein victims were offered ₹25,000 to ₹30,000 per cycle and repeatedly used as egg donors, resulting in physical exploitation

title: Jharkhand civic polls: 23% voter turnout recorded in 48 ULBs till 11 a.m.
content: As many as 562 candidates, including 235 women, are in the fray for the posts of Mayor and chairperson, while 5,562 candidates, including 2,727 women, are contesting the posts of ward councillors

title: Govt exempts tailing recycling in mines from fresh green clearance
content: Industry experts said earlier, even activities like tailing recycling within approved mine areas required separate EC, leading to delays

title: Tamil Nadu SIR final electoral roll LIVE: 5.67 crore voters in State after deletion of nearly 70 lakh electors
content: The final electoral roll of Puducherry was published on February 14, 2026 after the statutory period for filing of claims and objections. The Union Territory has an electorate of 9,44,211

title: Watch: Guwahati’s new airport terminal now operational
content: The new terminal at Lokapriya Gopinath Bordoloi International Airport began commercial operations on February 22, marking a major boost to connectivity in the Northeast. Himanta Biswa Sarma welcomed the first passengers as a ceremonial boarding pass was issued. Designed by architect Nuru Karim, the award-winning terminal is inspired by Assam’s kopou phool and features over 140 MT of bamboo, blending regional identity with modern infrastructure.

title: PM Modi condoles demise of ex-Union Minister Mukul Roy
content: Roy was once regarded as West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's most trusted lieutenant and the TMC's principal strategist

title: Shirtless protest at AI Summit: Delhi Police nabs Youth Congress worker in Gwalior, total arrests 5
content: The investigators are also probing the financial trail behind the protest, including who funded printing slogans on the T-shirts

title: Allegations of medical negligence after child dies following injections at hospital in Kerala’s Kattakkada
content: The family alleged that the two-and-a-half-year-old child, who was brought to Mamal multispeciality hospital with breathlessness, was given injections at the hospital, following which the child lost consciousness

title: Kerala Assembly Budget session resumes amid Opposition uproar over Sabarimala gold theft case
content: Soon after Question Hour began, Opposition persisted with its demand that Devaswom Minister should resign. Opposition also reiterated its allegation that Chief Minister’s office was interfering with the SIT probe

title: Delhi Secretariat, two schools receive bomb threat; declared hoax
content: According to the police, Army Public School in Dhaula Kuan and Air Force Bal Bharti School on Lodhi Road received bomb threats

title: PhonePe launches AI-powered natural language search built on Microsoft Foundry
content: "This feature enables PhonePe users to initiate and complete in-app tasks via natural language text or voice commands, enhancing convenience and bringing personalisation to the platform’s overall experience," PhonePe

title: VACB records Union Minister Suresh Gopi’s statement in Sabarimala flagmast installation case
content: Suresh Gopi is among 27 persons who donated gold and cash for installation of flagmast. Officials say actors Mohanlal and Renji Panicker, and film producer M. Renjith, were among the donors, and that VACB will record their statements

title: Congress demands arrest of BJP State president Madhav
content: Congress party leader Kolanukonda Shivaji accuses him of inciting attack on the party headquarters in Vijayawada

title: Mukul Roy, former Union Railway Minister, passes away after prolonged illness
content: Mukul Roy breathed his last  at 1.30 a.m. at the private hospital, his son Subhranshu Roy said, adding that he had been in a coma for the last several days

title: Why are apple traders in J&K worried? | Explained
content: Why are apple producers concerned about the trade deals with the U.S. and the EU? Why are countries in the West able to produce a better yield of apples? What about controlled-atmosphere cold storage prices? Why are party leaders urging the Union government to re-evaluate the deal?

title: Indian Embassy issues advisory for its nationals in Mexico after powerful drug lord El Mencho killed
content: Indian citizens were advised by Embassy to avoid areas around law enforcement activity and to be aware of their surroundings and avoid crowds. They were told to seek shelter and minimize unnecessary movements outside shelter and follow local news for updates.

title: Uttarakhand education staff to boycott work over 'assault' of director by BJP MLA supporters
content: The meeting also decided that if the accused are not arrested within two days, all offices in the State, from the nagar panchayat to the state secretariat, will boycott work starting February 25.

title: Bengal unemployment aid scheme | Queuing up for cash
content: Lakhs of people in the 21-40 age group are lining up across West Bengal to register for the Banglar Yuba Saathi scheme announced by the Trinamool Congress government ahead of the Assembly poll. Shrabana Chatterjee and Shiv Sahay Singh look into what this unemployment allowance means for those who do not have jobs and how they are surviving in meagrely paid contractual jobs offered by the State

title: 'Continued delay' in restoration of Statehood to J&K is concerning: Farooq Abdullah
content: Repeated assurances have been made at the highest levels regarding the restoration of statehood at the earliest. However, the absence of a clear timeline has created uncertainty and disappointment among the people, says Farooq Abdullah

title: Ruling powers conspiring to weaken Constitution: Tejashwi Yadav
content: Tejashwi Yadav termed the BJP a reservation-thief, adding that the double-engine government has deprived the exploited, the backward, the most backward, the Dalits, and the tribals of reservations.

title: RCP Singh pitches to come back in JD(U)
content: Senior JD-(U) leader and Union Minister Rajeev Ranjan Singh alias Lalan Singh and Bihar Minister Shravan Kumar have been openly opposing his entry into the party. RCP asserted that his presence in JD-(U) will benefit the party and organisation.

title: Protecting the freedom of speech of MPs
content: That the freedom of speech of MPs is subject to the rules of the Houses seems to have created the wrong impression that the provisions of the rules can override constitutional rights

title: Congress still weighing options as it enters negotiating table for T.N. Assembly polls
content: Meanwhile, a senior member of the VCK, another ally, says if the DMDK is allotted more than six or seven seats, it meant the DMK was preparing for the Congress’s exit

title: Over 300 textile mills shut in Tamil Nadu in last few years, says report
content: Many small-scale mills have shut due to rising input costs, steep hike in power tariff, and high cost of borrowing, says spinning mills association

title: 8 persons admitted to hospitals in Rajahmundry with symptoms of anuria
content: Elderly woman dies on Sunday; victims believed to have consumed adulterated milk; blood samples being collected

title: India condemns Pakistan's airstrikes on Afghan territory
content: New Delhi described the strikes as another attempt by Pakistan to "externalise its internal failures", and reiterated its support for Afghanistan's sovereignty and territorial integrity

title: H.D. Kumaraswamy asks Chief Minister Siddaramaiah to vacate his post to show love and generosity towards Vokkaligas
content: Hitting back at Chief Minister Siddaramaiah over his comments on the Janata Dal (Secular) leadership and Vokkaliga politics, Union Minister for Heavy Industries and Steel H.D. Kumaraswamy on Sunday suggested that the time was ripe for him to shower love on Vokkaligas by vacating his post

title: Now, Siddaramaiah lists out Vokkaligas in Congress capable of providing leadership to community
content: CM says Congress is the only party that could provide opportunities for those from Vokkaliga and Dalit communities to become Chief Ministers in future

title: Looking forward to Israel visit: PM Modi
content: India deeply values the enduring friendship with Israel, built on trust, innovation and a shared commitment to peace and progress, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Minister launches project to build three new bypass roads in Tiruvannamalai
content: The roads will help vehicles bypass narrow stretches between Tindivanam and Tiruvannamalai, and reach places like Coimbatore, Salem, Krishnagiri, Dharmapuri, Hosur, Bengaluru, and Vellore

title: Healthy lifestyle key to keeping heart fit, says doctor
content: Nearly 80% of cardiac ailments preventable, says Dr. A. Purnanand at Praja Arogya Vedika seminar in Vijayawada

title: BSP striving to obtain ‘master key of power’ through democratic means, says Mayawati at all-India meet
content: The national meeting held in Lucknow also flags trade concerns, notes challenges to safeguard interests and future of country’s farmers and Bahujans

title: LeBron stumps for C's Brown in MVP conversation
content: After Jaylen Brown fueled the Celtics' win over the Lakers on Sunday, he received an MVP endorsement from the other side of the storied rivalry.

title: Pacers star Haliburton diagnosed with shingles
content: Pacers point guard Tyrese Haliburton was diagnosed with shingles and will be away from the team for a few weeks, coach Rick Carlisle said Sunday.

title: Kara Braxton, 2-time WNBA champion, dies at 43
content: Kara Braxton, a two-time WNBA champion with the Detroit Shock and former SEC Freshman of the Year at Georgia, has died at the age of 43.

title: Games in Mexico called off after cartel boss killed
content: Four high-level soccer matches were postponed Sunday after the Mexican army killed the leader of a powerful drug cartel in a town close to the World Cup host city of Guadalajara.

title: McKay: Not expecting tush push ban proposal
content: NFL competition committee co-chairman Rich McKay said Sunday that he is not anticipating an attempt to ban the tush push this year.

title: Shields keeps title with win vs. rival Crews-Dezurn
content: Claressa Shields defended her undisputed heavyweight title Sunday night in Detroit by defeating longtime rival Franchon Crews-Dezurn by unanimous decision.

title: Italy throws farewell party, passes torch to France
content: The 2026 Winter Olympics ended as the twin flames in co-host cities Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo were extinguished during a closing ceremony inside ancient Verona Arena.

title: Who makes Team USA in men's hockey at the 2030 Olympics?
content: While the 2026 roster returns home with medals, here's who could represent the U.S. in the French Alps Games.

title: Who is the best player in this NFL draft class? Could Vegas trade out of No. 1? We asked around the league
content: We asked NFL execs, scouts and players to weigh in on the Raiders' No. 1 pick and the best prospects in 2026.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: The SEC is the new bids leader, Wisconsin ups its 'lock' odds
content: The Big Ten had an edge over the SEC in projected bid count -- but Saturday's shake-ups have led to a swap.

title: MLB.TV on ESPN: Subscription cost, game coverage, more facts
content: ESPN is the home of MLB.TV! Learn how to sign up for a subscription, watch your favorite games and take full advantage of this exciting product now.

title: Tyler Reddick triumphs in 2OT, gives Jordan another win
content: Tyler Reddick rebounded from a crash to become the first driver in 17 years to sweep the first two races of a NASCAR Cup Series season, winning in double overtime Sunday at Echo Park Speedway.

title: Arsenal answer title pressure with resounding derby win at Tottenham
content: Despite the growing pressure in the title race, Mikel Arteta's team responded with character to claim a 4-1 victory over their local rivals and deliver a message to their critics.

title: Messi struggles in MLS opener; will it impact his World Cup hopes?
content: Lionel Messi had a decent game in the 3-0 defeat to LAFC, but decent isn't what you expect from him, especially during a World Cup year.

title: How does an NFL player decide to retire? 'I'm not done'
content: Eric Weddle, Tony Jefferson and Andrew Whitworth share stories of their journeys in and out of retirement.

title: Who's the best second baseman in MLB? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: Does Marte's offense put him on top? Or does Hoerner's elite defense make him No. 1? Here's how our list shakes out.

title: Ranking the top 10 first basemen in MLB: Is Vlad Jr. or Kurtz No. 1?
content: Our top-10 rankings continue with a look at baseball's best first basemen, including the A's budding star.

title: World No. 1 Jeeno Thitikul wins home LPGA Thailand
content: World No. 1 Jeeno Thitikul justified her top billing in emphatic fashion after beating Japan's Chizzy Iwai by one stroke to capture and claim her home LPGA Thailand tournament for the first time.

title: NBA MVP straw poll 2.0: SGA, Jokic lead our update -- but chaos looms
content: With so many MVP contenders in danger of missing the 65-game threshold, this race could take a sharp turn.

title: College football's 100 best quarterbacks of the 2000s
content: Make way for Fernando Mendoza and others on Bill Connelly's updated list of the greatest quarterbacks of the century.

title: Boxing is better when Ryan Garcia is on top of his game
content: The stakes have never been higher for Ryan Garcia, with Shakur Stevenson and Devin Haney waiting in the wings.

title: MVP should book these fights on the Rousey vs. Carano card
content: Brock Lesnar and Anderson Silva back in MMA? Jake Paul could take the May 16 card over the top with names like that.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye Sporting CP defender, Ben White future uncertain
content: Ben White could leave Arsenal this summer, while Luka Modric is reportedly open to returning home to Croatia. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Rape Or Blackmail? Claim vs Claim In Bengaluru Valentine's Day Party Mystery
content: A 19-year-old college student was allegedly drugged and sexually assaulted by two men at a private villa in Bengaluru. The incident took place on Valentine's Day at a party the woman was invited to.

title: 'Tough Action Needed, But...': Congress MP's Warning After Terror Arrests
content: Congress MP Imran Masood has said that while strict action is necessary to fight terror, security agencies must ensure that innocent people are not targeted

title: Mexico Fears More Violence After Army Kills Leader Of Powerful Jalisco Cartel
content: School was canceled in several Mexican states and local and foreign governments alike warned their citizens to stay inside, as widespread violence erupted following the army's killing of the powerful leader of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel.

title: North Korea Touts Nuclear Advances As Kim Re-Chosen To Lead Ruling Party
content: North Korea's ruling party touted nuclear advances as it re-elected Kim Jong Un to the top post of general secretary, state media said Monday, during a rare national congress.

title: Supreme Court Decision Against Trump Tariffs Raises Uncertainty, But Markets Calm
content: The Supreme Court's ruling against U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs has countries like China and South Korea watching for Washington's next steps, while financial markets took the news in stride.

title: "US Military Buildup Around Iran Like Dante's Inferno": Ex-NATO Commander
content: Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei sits "at the very centre" of overwhelming American firepower now gathering around Iran, retired US Navy admiral James G Stavridis has said.

title: IDFC First Bank's Stock Fall 20% After Rs 590-Crore Fraud
content: Shares of IDFC First Bank tumbled 20 per cent on Monday after the private sector lender disclosed a Rs 590-crore fraud committed by its employees and others in accounts held by the Haryana government.

title: Amazon Inaugurates New Office In Bengaluru, It Is Asia's 2nd Largest
content: Amazon has officially opened its second-largest office in Bengaluru, further strengthening its long-term commitment to India.

title: Opinion: Opinion | With Trump's Tariffs Lost In Court, What Happens To India-US Deal Now?
content: Post the US Supreme Court's order striking down Trump's tariffs, the legal and economic baseline for an India-US deal has shifted sharply.

title: 4 Gujarat Tourists Abuse Staff At Arunachal Pradesh Resort, Video Goes Viral
content: Four members of a Gujarat family have been booked after a video went viral allegedly showing two of them abusing and threatening staff at a resort in Arunachal Pradesh's Dibang Valley.

title: Air India Issues Advisory As US Winter Storm Nears, 2-Feet Snow Predicted
content: Air India cancelled all flight to and from the New York and Newark airports on Tuesday, while several other airlines offered free date change or refund as northeast US braced for a massive snowstorm.

title: "Best Chief Minister Maharashtra Never Had": Devendra Fadnavis On Ajit Pawar
content: The air crash that killed Ajit Pawar robbed Maharashtra of a leader who could have been an excellent chief minister, Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis stressed in the state assembly on Monday.

title: Downed Helicopter To Mayor's Execution: Key Cases Against El Mencho's Cartel
content: El Mencho was one of the most wanted drug lords in Mexico and internationally. As the head of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG), he led one of the country's most powerful and violent criminal organisations.

title: "Civilians Targeted": Kabul After Pakistan Says 70 Killed In Afghan Border Attack
content: Pakistan's military has claimed that it has killed at least 70 in strikes along the border with Afghanistan over the weekend, targeting what it described as terror hideouts, which it blamed for recent attacks inside the country.

title: How A Disagreement Over Dust Turned Into A Racist Attack In Delhi
content: The students, one of whom is preparing for the UPSC civil services examination, alleged they were racially abused and intimidated by their neighbours in South Delhi's Malviya Nagar.

title: "Leave By Available Means Of Transport": India's Advisory To Citizens In Iran
content: In its latest advisory, the Embassy of India asked its citizens to "leave Iran by available means of transport, including commercial flights."

title: This India City Is Emerging As Fastest-Growing Ultra-Premium Residential Hub
content: India's luxury housing market has found a new leader in 2025, with Gurugram emerging as the country's fastest-growing ultra-premium residential hub, a report said on Monday.

title: Corporate India To See 9.1% Salary Hike In 2026: Report
content: Corporate India is expected to roll out an average salary increase of 9.1 per cent in 2026, with Global Capability Centres (GCCs) leading the growth in pay, a new report said on Monday.

title: IDFC FIRST Bank Detects Rs 590 Crore Fraud In Haryana Government Accounts
content: IDFC First Bank on Sunday disclosed a Rs 590-crore fraud committed by its employees and others in accounts held by the Haryana government with the private sector lender.
